poem:
### Thanksgiving Storm

A flurry of white envelopes hurrying  
across the open fields—  
the Midwest blanketed in haste,  
while travelers dream of hearthside warmth.  
An interstate tango, 45 cars swaying,  
wrapped in winter's thrust.  
As snowflakes kiss the windshield,  
the sky blurs—  
silent as the pause before a wish.
